verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar the king made an image of gold , whose height \add was\add* threescore cubits , \add and\add* the breadth thereof six cubits : he set it up in the plain of Dura , in the province of Babylon.

Then Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the princes , the governors , and the captains , the judges , the treasurers , the counsellors , the sheriffs , and all the rulers of the provinces , to come to the dedication of the image which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

Then the princes , the governors , and captains , the judges , the treasurers , the counsellors , the sheriffs , and all the rulers of the provinces , were gathered together unto the dedication of the image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up ; and they stood before the image that Nebuchadnezzar had set up.
Then an herald cried aloud , To you it is commanded , O people , nations , and languages ,\f + \fr 3.4 \ft aloud: Chaldee, with might\f*\f + \fr 3.4 \ft it…: Chaldee, they command\f*

\add That\add* at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet , flute , harp , sackbut , psaltery , dulcimer , and all kinds of musick , ye fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king hath set up :\f + \fr 3.5 \ft dulcimer: or, singing: Chaldee, symphony\f*
And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.

Therefore at that time , when all the people heard the sound of the cornet , flute , harp , sackbut , psaltery , and all kinds of musick , all the people , the nations , and the languages , fell down \add and\add* worshipped the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up. \p
¶ Wherefore at that time certain Chaldeans came near , and accused the Jews.
They spake and said to the king Nebuchadnezzar , O king , live for ever.

Thou , O king , hast made a decree , that every man that shall hear the sound of the cornet , flute , harp , sackbut , psaltery , and dulcimer , and all kinds of musick , shall fall down and worship the golden image :\f + \fr 3.10 \ft dulcimer: or, singing: Chaldee, symphony\f*
And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth , \add that\add* he should be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.

There are certain Jews whom thou hast set over the affairs of the province of Babylon , Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego ; these men , O king , have not regarded thee : they serve not thy gods , nor worship the golden image which thou hast set up.\f + \fr 3.12 \ft have…: Chaldee, have set no regard upon thee\f* \p
¶ Then Nebuchadnezzar in \add his\add* rage and fury commanded to bring Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego. Then they brought these men before the king.

Nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, \add Is it\add* true , O Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , do not ye serve my gods , nor worship the golden image which I have set up?\f + \fr 3.14 \ft true: or, of purpose\f*

Now if ye be ready that at what time ye hear the sound of the cornet , flute , harp , sackbut , psaltery , and dulcimer , and all kinds of musick , ye fall down and worship the image which I have made ; \add well:\add* but if ye worship not , ye shall be cast the same hour into the midst of a burning fiery furnace ; and who \add is\add* that God that shall deliver you out of my hands ?\f + \fr 3.15 \ft dulcimer: or, singing: Chaldee, symphony\f*
Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , answered and said to the king , O Nebuchadnezzar , we \add are\add* not careful to answer thee in this matter.
If it be \add so\add*, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace , and he will deliver \add us\add* out of thine hand , O king.
But if not , be it known unto thee, O king , that we will not serve thy gods , nor worship the golden image which thou hast set up. \p

¶ Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury , and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego : \add therefore\add* he spake , and commanded that they should heat the furnace one seven times more than it was wont to be heated.\f + \fr 3.19 \ft full: Chaldee, filled\f*

And he commanded the most mighty men that \add were\add* in his army to bind Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , \add and\add* to cast \add them\add* into the burning fiery furnace.\f + \fr 3.20 \ft most…: Chaldee, mighty of strength\f*

Then these men were bound in their coats , their hosen , and their hats , and their \add other\add* garments , and were cast into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.\f + \fr 3.21 \ft coats: or, mantles\f*\f + \fr 3.21 \ft hats: or, turbans\f*

Therefore because the king’s commandment was urgent , and the furnace exceeding hot , the flame of the fire slew those men that took up Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego.\f + \fr 3.22 \ft commandment: Chaldee, word\f*\f + \fr 3.22 \ft flame: or, spark\f*
And these three men , Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , fell down bound into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.

Then Nebuchadnezzar the king was astonied , and rose up in haste , \add and\add* spake , and said unto his counsellors , Did not we cast three men bound into the midst of the fire ? They answered and said unto the king , True , O king.\f + \fr 3.24 \ft counsellors: or, governors\f*

He answered and said , Lo , I see four men loose , walking in the midst of the fire , and they have no hurt ; and the form of the fourth is like the Son of God.\f + \fr 3.25 \ft they…: Chaldee, there is no hurt in them\f* \p

¶ Then Nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burning fiery furnace , \add and\add* spake , and said , Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , ye servants of the most high God , come forth , and come \add hither\add*. Then Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , came forth of the midst of the fire.\f + \fr 3.26 \ft mouth: Chaldee, door\f*

And the princes , governors , and captains , and the king’s counsellors , being gathered together , saw these men , upon whose bodies the fire had no power , nor was an hair of their head singed , neither were their coats changed , nor the smell of fire had passed on them. \p

\add Then\add* Nebuchadnezzar spake , and said , Blessed \add be\add* the God of Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , who hath sent his angel , and delivered his servants that trusted in him , and have changed the king’s word , and yielded their bodies , that they might not serve nor worship any god , except their own God.

Therefore I make a decree , That every people , nation , and language , which speak any thing amiss against the God of Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , shall be cut in pieces , and their houses shall be made a dunghill : because there is no other God that can deliver after this sort.\f + \fr 3.29 \ft I make…: Chaldee, a decree is made by me\f*\f + \fr 3.29 \ft any…: Chaldee, error\f*\f + \fr 3.29 \ft cut…: Chaldee, made pieces\f*
Then the king promoted Shadrach , Meshach , and Abed-nego , in the province of Babylon.\f + \fr 3.30 \ft promoted: Chaldee, made to prosper\f*
